overview: Elizabeth joined Arts Alliance Media full-time in March 2009 as VP, Alternative Content Distribution. She had worked with the AAM team previously as a consultant on the highly successful launch of the Royal Opera House season in cinemas. Elizabeth oversees the release strategy for AAM’s live and recorded special events including the global cinema releases of Iron Maiden: Flight 666 and the climate change documentary The Age of Stupid. Elizabeth has over 25 years of traditional film distribution experience working across sales, marketing and acquisitions. She started her career at Unifrance in New York working closely with the Film Department of the Museum of Modern Art, and later moved to London where she joined the publicity team of the London Film Festival. She joined Electric Pictures (now Momentum) as Head of Distribution and went on to hold senior roles at Pathe Distribution (Deputy MD), Icon (General Manager) and Twentieth Century Fox (Head of Fox Searchlight UK). Elizabeth has taught at the Cologne Film School and been a mentor for NW Vision. Elizabeth has a BA from Sarah Lawrence College, Bronxville, New York.
